description: Delta is extending benefits for mileage plan members unable to travel because of the coronavirus outbreak.
title: Delta and United extend mileage plan benefits for customers unable to fly because of coronavirus
title_page: Delta and United extend mileage plan benefits for customers unable to fly because of coronavirus - CNN
maintext:
New York (CNN Business) Delta is extending benefits for mileage plan members unable to travel because of the coronavirus outbreak.
Delta DAL is the first major airline to announce extensions to its mileage programs, meant to reassure customers that their travel perks will still be there once fears and risks surrounding the outbreak have subsided.
"As coronavirus continues to dramatically impact travel across the globe, you don't have to worry about your benefits -â€” they'll be extended so you can enjoy them when you are ready to travel again," Sandeep Dube, Delta's senior vice president for customer engagement and loyalty, said in a statement Sunday.
Among the measures, Delta SkyMiles Medallion members will have their current status extended through 2021, rather than having them expire at the end of 2020. Similarly, all Medallion Qualifying Miles from 2020 will be rolled over to next year to qualify for 2022 status.
